page.title: 07PAYTON'S NURSERY OF ALDERLEY
page.content: There has been a nursery on this site for sixty years, although the present owners, Mr. and Mrs. Payton only bought it this year. They decided to run the nursery because the two shops they have in Stockport had become too demanding on their time. The opening hours for the nursery are 8.30am to 5.00pm every day but the staff work fourteen hours a day, looking after the flowers and doing floral arrangements. The staff need a lot of knowledge of plant care. They buy most of their plants from other nurseries in Cheshire, mainly one at Lower Peover. Most of the conifers come from Holland. They have 150 kinds of shrubs and nearly 80 kinds of conifers. The most popular kinds of plants are heathers,climbing plants and conifers.
